title: Chip Dynamic Power Calculation
problem_statement:
Chip Dynamic Power Calculation

Problem Description

Consider that you are designing a chip that has the following parameters.

  • Average activity factor: 0.4
  • Average switching capacitance: 100 pF/mm2
  • VDD: 2 V
  • Logic frequency of operation: 3 GHz
  • Area of chip: 50 mm2

Complete the blank in the following question with the appropriate answer.

Dynamic power consumed by the chip is _______ Watts

Program Output with SWAP Function

Problem Description

Consider the given below program (SWAP will interchange the values of the variables):

INTEGER a, b, c
INTEGER res = 0
while (b > 0) {
    res += (a % c) + (c % a)
    b -= a % c
    SWAP(a, c)
}
PRINT res

What will be the output of the program if a, b and c are assigned values as given in the table below:

  • a: 10
  • b: 25
  • c: 16

Complete the blank in the following question with the appropriate answer.

Answer: _______

NMOS Circuit Voltage Calculation

Problem Description

Consider the following circuit of identical NMOS transistors connected as shown in the figure below: VTH represents the threshold voltage of all the transistors.

Note: For non-integer results represent with decimal values Ex: 1.2, 0.18, ...

The circuit parameters are:

  • VDD: 1.5 V
  • VTH: 0.25 V
  • T3 gate: 1.4 V

Complete the blanks in the following question with the appropriate answer.

  1. Voltage at node "N1" is _______ V
  2. Voltage at node "N2" is _______ V
  3. Voltage at node "N3" is _______ V

Output of printSpans Function

Problem Description

Given an array A, what is the output of following function?

void printSpans(int A[], int n)
{
    int S[n];
    S[0] = 1;
    for (int i = 1; i < n; i++)
    {
        S[i] = 1;
        for (int j = i - 1; (j >= 0) && (A[i] >= A[j]); j--)
        {
            S[i]++;
        }
    }

    for (int k = 0; k < n; k++)
    {
        printf("%d ", S[k]);
    }
}

The parameters for the function call are:

  • A[]: [60, 80, 60, 70, 60, 75, 85]
  • n: 7

Complete the blank in the following question with the appropriate answer.

Answer: _______

Digital Circuit Glitch Filtering Counter Width

Problem Description

Following digital circuit is designed to make sure that only intended button presses are registered by filtering out any glitches which are narrower than stable-time parameter. Any change in the input clears the counter (CLR) and input is latched to result (FF3) only if its held stable for 'stable-time' at least.

The circuit parameters are:

  • Clock frequency (clk): 10 MHz
  • Stable time (stable_time): 150 micro-seconds (us)

Complete the blank in the following question with the appropriate answer.

For the given clock frequency of operation and stable-time parameters, what should be the min. width of the counter (N) to filter the glitches: _______

title: Boat Travel
problem_statement:
Boat Travel

Problem Description

A ship travels downstream at X Nm/h (Nautical miles per hour), on the still water at Y Nm/h, and upstream at only Z Nm/h.

The ship takes T1 hours to travel from city A to city B.

The return trip takes T2 hours.

Find the distance between the two cities.

Note: There will be some downstream water, still water and upstream water between cities A and B.

Input Values:

  • X: 72
  • Y: 63
  • Z: 56
  • T1 (hours): 7
  • T2 (hours): 15

Architecture Machine Operand

Problem Description

A 32-bit architecture machine has fixed length 1-word long (32 bit) instructions each. It has X 32-bit registers.

It needs to support Y instructions, which have an immediate operand (a constant value) in addition to two register operands.

Assuming that the immediate operand is an unsigned integer.

Note: An example instruction is as below ADD R1,R2,2000 (R1 and R2 are registers index. 2000 is the immediate operand)

Input Values:

  • X: 256
  • Y: 45

Count Rectangles in Grid

Problem Description

Find the number of rectangles in the following picture?

Note: Square is also considered as a type of rectangle

The picture shows a 6x6 grid.

Wire Segment Delays

Problem Description

A wire of length Li has delay of Ti. A Buffer of delay Tbuf is inserted at each of the points P1 and P2, thereby creating 3 wire segments of Lengths La, Lb & Lc with Delays Ta, Tb & Tc respectively.

The new circuit is shown below:

Input Values:

  • Li: 200 um
  • Ti: 400 ps
  • P1: 40 um
  • P2: 120 um
  • Tbuf: 60 ps

DRAM Fetch Cycles

Problem Description

What is the number of cycle DRAM cycles to fetch X Byte data (Value given below) and bus width is Y bit (Value given below) for a DDR DRAM.

PS: Assume no contrain on Burst Length

Input Values:

  • X (Byte data): 32
  • Y (bus width in bits): 16

title: Problem 11
problem_statement:
Problem 11

Problem Description

While multiplying three integers, Andy took one of the numbers as M instead of N. As a result, the product went up by Q.

For the given values of N and M, the minimum possible value of the sum of squares of the other two numbers is:

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
N = 16
M = 61
Q = 1800
---

Problem 12

Problem Description

For the given digital circuit, assume the gate delay of all combinational gates is equal and as given below. In the accompanying timing diagram, find out the value of a,b,c,d.

a = _________ ;

b = _________ ;

c = _________ ;

d = _________ ;

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
Gate delay = 14
---

Problem 13

Problem Description

The average power dissipated in the resistor after many clock cycles is _________ mW

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
Initial state of flip-flops:
D1 = 1
D2 = 0
D3 = 0
D4 = 1
D5 = 0
Supply voltage = 1V
Resistor R = 1kOhms
---

Problem 14

Problem Description

Given the function solve, what will be the output of solve(s)?

void solve(char *str)
{
    char *s = str;
    int l=0, r= strlen(s)-1, ans= -1;
    while(l<=r)
    {
        int mid = (l + r)/2;

        if(s[mid] == '1')
        {
            ans = mid;
            r = mid -1;
        }
        else
        {
            l = mid +1;
        }
    }
    printf("%d", ans);
}

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
s = 95759110150111111

Answer: _________

---

Problem 15

Problem Description

Consider a combinational logic which has N input bits and N output bits. The logic right rotates the input N bits by R (R<=N).

If the logic is implemented using only 2x1 muxes, what is the minimum number of such muxes required for the given N? _________

Examples

Example 1:

Input:
Hint: For R=1, out0 = in(N-1), out1=in0...out(N-1)=in(N-2)
N = 48

Constraints

  • R <= N

title: C Program Output Prediction
problem_statement:
```html

C Program Output Prediction

Problem Description

Given the following C program, determine its output when the array m is initialized from the parameters section.

main()
{
    int m[];
    //m[] will be initialized from the parameters section.
    //below is just an example
    //int m[] = {2,4,6,8,10};
    int i, sum=0, *n=m+4;
    for (i=0; i<5; i++) {
        sum=sum+(*n-i)-(n-i);
    }
    printf("%d\n", sum);
    return 0;
}

Parameters:

m[5] = {8, 3, 3, 11, 20};

4-bit Right Shift Register Clock Cycles

Problem Description

A 4-bit shift register circuit configured for right-shift operation is shown below. Determine the number of clock cycles required to transition from the initial state to the final state.

(Circuit diagram not convertible to text)

Initial State:

ABCD state at the Initial state: 1101

Final State:

ABCD state at the Final state: 1010

Cache Memory Tag Array Size Calculation

Problem Description

A system has X MB, Y way set associative cache with block size Z Bytes. The processor generates M bit addresses. In addition to the tag, there are 2 valid bits, 1 replacement bit, and 1 modified bit per cache line.

Calculate the size of the tag array in KBytes given the following parameters:

  • X: 1 MB (Cache Size)
  • Y: 4 (Ways of associativity)
  • Z: 32 Bytes (Block Size)
  • M: 64 (Processor Address Bits)

Recursive Function Evaluation

Problem Description

Given a recursive function defined by the relation:

f(x + 2) = f(x) + f(x + 1), for all positive integers x.

And the following known values:

  • f(7) = M
  • f(15) = N

Calculate the value of f(10) given the following parameters:

  • M: 15
  • N: 135

Minimum Clock Period of Sequential Circuit

Problem Description

In the following sequential circuit, the Setup Time, Hold Time, and Clock-to-Q delays are the same for both Flip-Flop 1 (FF1) and Flip-Flop 2 (FF2). t1 and t2 represent the propagation delays for the various combinational elements in the circuit.

(Circuit diagram not convertible to text)

Determine the minimum clock period (in ns) at which the circuit can operate, using the following delay values:

  • t1: min delay = 2 ns, max delay = 5 ns
  • t2: min delay = 3 ns, max delay = 4 ns
  • tck to q: min delay = 6 ns, max delay = 8 ns
  • tsetup: 3 ns
  • thold: 2 ns
```
